Forgot Password Set Password Privacy & Terms Help Calories Consumed Suggested Meals Activity Suggested Meals Fragment Task Done Clicked FoodTaskDoneImageActivity //On Boarding strings Life in Control helps you manage and control your diabetes. Want to know how? Yes, why not! YES Skip Skip GOT IT Got it Collaborative Care Diet and Activity Tips Get personalized lifestyle coaching from experts Manage your condition together with your family Let\'s get started... Any associated problems? Tell us some more... How long have you had diabetes? SAVE AND NEXT Hello , Hello %1$s! Welcome to Life In Control. We understand that living with diabetes can be tough. However, you are not alone in your endeavors. Our experts will help you better manage your diabetes to live a happy and healthy life. All we need is your active involvement. Together we can conquer your diabetes. Log & track your health data to take better control of your diabetes LET\'S START \"%1$s, we appreciate the sincerity you show towards your health. Let’s try to improve it further now.\" \"%1$s, You have done a commendable job in controlling your diabetes. Let’s try to improve it further now.\" Enter your invite code Invite code I have an Invite Code No, I am here to explore I\'ll skip my gift Not a user already? Please wait while we setup your account. //user information strings Date of Birth Last HbA1c Last Fasting Blood Sugar Blood Glucose Gender Height Weight ft in BMI Blood Pressure Cholesterol (LDL) It seems are you are currently offline. \nPlease check your internet connectivity Please connect to internet to get lab schedule. Are you sure you want to logout? Sorry, we can\'t find invite code. Please enter it by yourself or sign up Please set a password. Found you, %1$s! Check out the goals that suit you best Check out the goals we agreed upon depending on your health profile \"%1$s, your sugar level has been out of control. Let us improve your lifestyle together.\” Here are your personalised daily goals Check out the daily goals we agreed upon depending on your health profile Invalid invite code. Please check and retry. InAppNotificationPopUp %1$s missed task reminders + %1$s more Your weight is not perfectly normal. Try to maintain it in the future. Note - BMI Range of 18.5 - 25 is considered as healthy weight. No time for meal logging?\nJust tell us what you had in 2 steps. No readings this %1$s No entries this %1$s Coming soon...stay tuned! Continue with Facebook Continue with Google HbA1c is the three-months normalized score of your blood sugar levels and is the best value to optimize for diabetes control. Getting your HbA1c values less than 6% is the ultimate destination in mastering your diabetes. I don\'t know my HbA1c Your weight and height help us determine your BMI and set appropriate goals for you. I don\'t know my weight and height To automatically set daily goals for you we need to know your gender. I don\'t know my gender We recommend the following HbA1c goal for you to be hit in 90 days Your BMI is %1$s. We recommend the following weight goal for you to be hit in 90 days. You can change this goal anytime you like. With a HbA1c of %1$s, your control over your diabetes is great! Keep up the good work! With a BMI of %1$s, you are in the right weight range already! Keep up the good work! Thanks for using the Life in Control app to manage your diabetes. Please help us with three simple questions to personalize your experience. Based on your current health profile here are your recommended daily goals. LabScheduleData Please upload a picture of the meal you had from the Gallery or click an image using the Camera. How would you like to set up your account? Nice to see you again! How would you like to log in? %1$s in association with Life In Control welcome you to his care plan. Through this app we will ensure that you always stay on top of your condition. While you\'re waiting, here are a few interesting facts about Diabetes Diabetes patients can eat sweets and chocolates in small portions, as long as these fit into the required calories intake For people with Diabetes, it may be better to eat fruit rather than drinking packaged fruit juice Baked paranthas are a tasty and healthy substitute for fried paranthas Access the Life in Control App Hi Hello Welcome to Life in Control! Welcome Thank you for trusting us with your health. As your care team, we shall do everything we can to keep you fit and healthy! But always remember, the most important member in your care team is you! Please confirm your mobile number to get started Let\'s get started Starting today, our Diabetes Coach will hold your hand and guide you to a healthier lifestyle. They will constantly monitor your health and set daily goals to meet your long-term health targets. But most importantly, they will always be available for support, as a guide and a friend. At Life in Control, We consider every patient with diabetes a hero for the courage with which they face the daily challenges of the condition. But even heroes need some support. Please log your current Height before setting up your goal. Please log your current waist before setting up your goal. Please log your current weight before setting up your goal. Your target Waist in the next 90 days: We need some more information for our new, intelligent health goals!\n\nIt won\'t take very long. Your weight goal and daily goals have been set by your doctor. You can view them in the manage goals section. Your weight goal and daily goals have been set. You can edit them in the manage goals section. Your daily goals have been set by your doctor. You can edit them in the manage goals section. Your daily goals have been set. You can edit them in the manage goals section. Your target weight cannot be same as your current weight! Your target waist cannot be same as your current waist! Your target HbA1c cannot be same as your current HbA1c! You have been logged out. Please login again to continue. You are using an older version. Get your customized Diet Plan \nIt’s good to see you take an active interest in your health!\n\nA healthy diet is a critical part of managing Diabetes, and hence it is one of the cornerstones of our special Diabetes Programme. The Program also contains access to a health expert on chat, a special activity plan as well as regular health review and follow up calls.\n\n We would also be to schedule a free health consultation for you! Reply back to this email if you are interested in any of this.\n\nTo your Good Healh!\n\nDr Seema Singh, \nMS (Surgery), PGPX \nHead, Program Operations \nCuro Healthcare Technologies Unit Settings UNIT CHANGE Kg lb mg/dL mmol To obtain optimal weight, your future goals should look like this Here are your daily goals to help you achieve your weight goal Do you want to clear logged activity ? Tap Back again to Exit Resend http://www.lifeincontrol.com/terms-and-conditions http://www.lifeincontrol.com/privacy-policy Please select a valid file type Please enter value for the lab test Please add files SURE Side Navigation \n\n\n\nPlease choose your meal from the options given below.\n\n\n You can find all your important information here; grouped perfectly for your use\n\n\n Let\'s start with logging your first meal Your tagged favourite meal will show up here You can tag your logged food items as your favourites \n\n\nInsights\n\nGet an overall as well as category-wise view of your blood sugar levels on your preferred timescale!\n\n\n \n\n\nHistory\n\nEasily understand how your diet, activity, and medicines impact your blood sugar levels on an interactive timeline!\n\n\n

Technical Definitions


a) Median Graph: The Median is the middle number when a group of numbers/data is arranged in ascending or descending order.

b) Percentile Graphs: When we say a number ‘x’ has a percentile of 95%, we mean that 95% of other numbers within its group have a value which is less than ‘x’.

Thus, the 10-90 percentile graph shows the numbers which are greater than 10% of the numbers and less then 90. Similarly, the 25-75 percentile graph show the numbers which are greater than 75 and less than 25.

Information

a) This graph shows how your Blood Glucose level varies through a given time.

b) The median line represents how your blood glucose generally varies across different days.

c) The percentile bands show how your blood glucose generally varies within each day.

d) The more the graph lies outside your target range, the more your blood sugar fluctuates, which is bad for your health!
